casebody.data:
Benjamin RUBENSTEIN, Defendant-Appellant, v. UNITED STATES of America, Plaintiff-Appellee. No. 7195. Circuit Court of Appeals, Third Circuit. Jan. 3, 1940. Max Mehler, of Newark, N. J., for appellant. Joseph W. Burns, Sp. Asst, to Atty Gen., for appellee.

Before BIGGS, MARIS, and JONES, Circuit Judges.

PER CURIAM.

Our examination of the bill of exceptions .in this case in the light of the appellant’s argument discloses no error therein which affected his substantial rights. See Gleckman v. United States, 8 Cir., 80 F.2d 394.

The judgment of the district court is affirmed.
